results.title: The Muppet movie
results.creator_credit: James Frawley, Jim Henson and ITC Entertainment
results.brief_description: Kermit the Frog has finally hit the big time and he’s heading for Hollywood. With his fellow Muppets including Miss Piggy, Gonzo, Animal, Fozzie Bear, plus the rest of the Muppet Performers, they encounter real life stars along the way. Kermit begins his journey on a humble bicycle, but as the passengers accumulate along the way his means of transport increases in size. Kermit also has to contend with the slimy Doc Hopper who is eager for Kermit to promote fried frog legs, as well as his strong feelings for Miss Piggy. Features a number of cameos as well as paying homage to several classic films.

results.title: The Munchers: a fable
results.brief_description: Animated clay figures representing teeth, plaque, bacteria, dental floss and the toothbrush present information on nutrition and dental health. The proper type of foods for optimum oral health is also discussed.

results.title: The Muncher  for ZX Spectrum 128
results.creator_credit: Rob Howard, Beam Software, Gremlin Graphics Software and Zero Wait
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover, badge and manual in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: The Muncher [computer game]. The Muncher is a single player side scrolling action game. Players control a rampaging monster destroying buildings by climbing on them, breathing fire and jumping on people and cars while attempting to avoid getting shot at by people with guns. The game ends when the monster’s health has been depleted by being attacked.

results.title: The Mummy returns
results.creator_credit: Steven Somers, Sean Daniel, James Jacks, Alphaville and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz and Arnold Vosloo return to star in this sequel to the 1999’s blockbuster, ‘The Mummy’. When evil mummy Lord Imhotep is resurrected in a British museum, Rich and Evie O’Connell develop feelings of deja-vu. The situation worsens when their son Alexander discovers the ancient arm bands belonging to the Scorpion King and puts them on, which will awaken the Scorpion King and bring forth the end of the world. When Imhotep discovers the wearer of the bracelets and the only thing standing in his way of reigning again is a child, he arranges for the child to be kidnapped, leaving Evie and Rich only days to save their son and the world from Imhotep and the Scorpion King. Cast also includes wrestling star The Rock, AKA Dwayne Johnson, as the Scorpion King.

results.title: The Mummy
results.creator_credit: Stephen Sommers, James Jacks, Sean Daniel, Patricia Carr and Alphaville Productions
results.brief_description: Loosely adapted from the classic 1932 horror film starring Boris Karloff, this version is set in Egypt, where over 3,000 years ago the high priest Imhotep (Arnold Vosloo) was given the all-important assignment of preparing the recently dead for their journey into the afterlife. However he made one fatal mistake - he became smitten with Anck-Su-Namun, the mistress of the Pharaoh. Driven mad by jealousy and love, Imhotep murdered the Pharaoh, and his punishment was to be buried alive and suffer the torment of an eternal life in his wretched tomb. In 1925, a band of adventurers seeking fame and fortune - led by Rick O’Connell (Brendan Fraser), an American expatriate who has joined the foreign legion, and Evelyn Carnarvon (Rachel Weisz), an amateur archaeologist - find a previously unknown burial site in Egypt. The team starts to dig, hoping to find lost riches but instead they disturb the tomb of Imhotep, causing him to rise from the grave to wreak vengeance on humanity.

results.title: The Mummy
results.creator_credit: Karl Freund, Carl Laemmle and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Boris Karloff’s role in the 1932 version of The Mummy has become a landmark in the annals of screen history. Karloff plays Im-Ho-Tep, the mummy, who is accidently revived after 3,700 years by a British archaeology team. In flashback, we find that he was a high priest who was embalmed alive for trying to revive the vestel virgin whom he loved after she had been sacrificed. Now, dressed in the garb of a modern day Egyptian, he sets out to find his lost love, mistaking Helen Grosvenor (Zita Johann) for her and terrorizing the expedition members who must find a way to stop him. Today, almost half a century after its production, this brooding, dream-like film remains a horror masterpiece. Also stars David Manners, Bramwell Fletcher, Arthur Byron and Edward Van Sloan. Based on a story by Nina Wilcox Putnam and Richard Schayer.

results.title: The Movies: our modern art. The Lost world revisited
results.creator_credit: W. Gyorgy, Dennis R. Atkinson and Spectre Pictures
results.brief_description: A tribute to the Special Effects wizardry of Willis H O’Brien. A 1925 production of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s story is a classic of the silent era, and with King Kong, produced eight years later, O’Brien was proved a master of special effects. Analyses his artistic genius and contains a rare interview with O’Brien taken shortly before his death in 1962.

results.title: The Movies story
results.creator_credit: Gerald A Schiller and SL Film Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of film from 1895 to 1915, beginning with Edison’s first experiments and concluding with Chaplin’s early shorts. Emphasises the contributions of Melies, Griffith and Chaplin. Narrated by William Wintersole.

results.title: The Movies go west
results.brief_description: A portrait of ‘Bronco Billy’ Anderson, the star of over 500 early Hollywood westerns. Narrated by one of Anderson’s co-stars, Hal Angus, and with the voice of Anderson himself.
